column3: `+4 -10` and *adds* a feature, this is a great first contribution, thanks!\nutACK ca33ac10d36199395bd6553db77e5ceacfdb925e (given that this passes Travis and Appveyor)
Force pushed in order to add co-author.

[Appveyor build](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/DrahtBot/bitcoin/builds/22561871) is failing with:
```
c:\projects itcoin\src\init.cpp(112): error C3861: '_getpid': identifier not found [C:\projects itcoin uild_msvc\libbitcoin_server\libbitcoin_server.vcxproj]

c:\projects itcoin\src\init.cpp(119): error C4996: 'strerror': This function or variable may be unsafe. Consider using strerr

I compiled this PR inside WSL and ran `bitcoin-qt` on a Windows 10 system. 
Looks like `bitcoin.pid` is created correctly, and contains the correct PID.

![windows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/53213891-8c113900-3685-11e9-9cc2-9107a1ec5922.png)
Update: AppVeyor build should now pass. I have updated the description with details
Concept ACK\n\nExcellent first-time contribution! Thanks! Hope to see more PR:s from you! :-)
utACK after squash, I think this is better as one commit to have an atomic change
Ok, can be added. Just note this was not added/modified by me and was merged in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15278 a few days ago
That was OK to use `e.what()` in other OS except Windows. So you have to use `fsbridge::get_filesystem_error_message(e)` instead.
